user_question: How can I capture the Milky Way with my DSLR camera?
final_answer: To capture the Milky Way with a DSLR camera, use a wide-angle lens, set your camera to manual mode, use a high ISO (1600-3200), a wide aperture (f/2.8 or lower), and a shutter speed of 20-30 seconds. Ensure you are in a dark location away from light pollution.
